001package com.cececandicorner.inventory; // IMPORTANT: Ensure this matches your package name
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.Collections;
005import java.util.List;
006
007/** InventoryManager.java
008* Manages the inventory of Bracelet objects for Cece's Candi Corner.
009* This class now interfaces with a DatabaseManager for persistent storage
010* instead of an in-memory list or text files.
011* It handles all core CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations,
012* and generates reports by delegating to the DatabaseManager.
013* It includes robust input validation to ensure data integrity.
014*/
015
016public class InventoryManager {
017    // No longer storing an in-memory list; operations delegate to database
018    private DatabaseManager dbManager;
019
020    /**
021     * Constructor to initialize the InventoryManager with a DatabaseManager.
022     * @param dbManager The DatabaseManager instance to use for database operations.
023     */
024    public InventoryManager(DatabaseManager dbManager) {
025        this.dbManager = dbManager;
026        // Ensure the table exists when manager is initialized
027        if (!dbManager.createTable()) {
028            System.err.println("Failed to ensure database table exists on startup.");
029        }
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * Getter for the inventory list. This now fetches all bracelets from the database.
034     * @return A list of Bracelet objects from the database.
035     */
036    public List<Bracelet> getInventory() {
037        return dbManager.selectAllBracelets();
038    }
039
040    // --- Input Validation Methods (private helpers) ---
041    /**
042     * Validates if the provided ID is not null or empty after trimming whitespace.
043     * @param itemId The ID string to validate.
044     * @return true if the ID is valid, false otherwise.
045     */
046    private boolean validateId(String itemId) {
047        return itemId != null && !itemId.trim().isEmpty();
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Validates if the provided description is not null or empty after trimming whitespace.
052     * @param description The description string to validate.
053     * @return true if the description is valid, false otherwise.
054     */
055    private boolean validateDescription(String description) {
056        return description != null && !description.trim().isEmpty();
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Validates if a string can be parsed into a non-negative integer for quantity.
061     * @param quantityStr The string representation of the quantity.
062     * @return The parsed integer quantity if valid, -1 to indicate an error.
063     */
064    private int validateQuantity(String quantityStr) {
065        try {
066            int quantity = Integer.parseInt(quantityStr);
067            if (quantity < 0) {
068                return -1; // Indicate error: negative quantity
069            }
070            return quantity;
071        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
072            return -1; // Indicate error: not a valid integer
073        }
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Validates if a string can be parsed into a non-negative double for price.
078     * @param priceStr The string representation of the price.
079     * @return The parsed double price if valid, -1.0 to indicate an error.
080     */
081    private double validatePrice(String priceStr) {
082        try {
083            double price = Double.parseDouble(priceStr);
084            if (price < 0) {
085                return -1.0; // Indicate error: negative price
086            }
087            return price;
088        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
089            return -1.0; // Indicate error: not a valid number
090        }
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Validates if the provided status string is either "In Stock" or "Out of Stock" (case-insensitive).
095     * @param status The status string to validate.
096     * @return true if the status is valid, false otherwise.
097     */
098    private boolean validateStatus(String status) {
099        return status != null && (status.equalsIgnoreCase("In Stock") || status.equalsIgnoreCase("Out of Stock"));
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Checks if a given bracelet ID already exists in the database.
104     * @param itemId The ID to check for uniqueness.
105     * @return true if the ID is unique (does not exist in database), false otherwise.
106     */
107    public boolean isIdUnique(String itemId) {
108        return !dbManager.doesIdExist(itemId);
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Finds a bracelet by its ID from the database.
113     * @param itemId The ID of the bracelet to find.
114     * @return The Bracelet object if found, null otherwise.
115     */
116    public Bracelet getBraceletById(String itemId) {
117        return dbManager.selectBraceletById(itemId);
118    }
119
120    // --- Core Functional Methods (adapted for GUI and Database) ---
121
122    /**
123     * Adds a new bracelet to the database.
124     * @param id The unique ID for the bracelet.
125     * @param description A brief description or name of the bracelet.
126     * @param quantityStr The current stock quantity of the bracelet.
127     * @param priceStr The selling price of the bracelet.
128     * @return A string message indicating the outcome (success or error).
129     */
130    public String addBracelet(String id, String description, String quantityStr, String priceStr) {
131        if (!validateId(id)) {
132            return "Error: ID cannot be empty.";
133        }
134        if (!isIdUnique(id)) { // Check uniqueness against database
135            return "Error: A bracelet with this ID already exists. Please enter a unique ID.";
136        }
137        if (!validateDescription(description)) {
138            return "Error: Description cannot be empty.";
139        }
140
141        int quantity = validateQuantity(quantityStr);
142        if (quantity == -1) {
143            return "Error: Quantity must be a valid non-negative integer.";
144        }
145
146        double price = validatePrice(priceStr);
147        if (price == -1.0) {
148            return "Error: Price must be a valid non-negative number.";
149        }
150
151        // Default status to "In Stock"
152        String status = "In Stock";
153
154        try {
155            Bracelet newBracelet = new Bracelet(id, description, quantity, price, status);
156            if (dbManager.insertBracelet(newBracelet)) { // Insert into database
157                return String.format("Successfully added: %s", newBracelet);
158            } else {
159                return "Error: Failed to add bracelet to database.";
160            }
161        } catch (Exception e) {
162            return String.format("An unexpected error occurred while adding the bracelet: %s", e.getMessage());
163        }
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Removes a bracelet from the database based on its unique ID.
168     * @param itemId The ID of the bracelet to remove.
169     * @return A string message indicating the outcome (success or error).
170     */
171    public String removeBracelet(String itemId) {
172        if (!validateId(itemId)) {
173            return "Error: Bracelet ID cannot be empty.";
174        }
175
176        if (!dbManager.doesIdExist(itemId)) { // Check existence in database
177            return String.format("Error: Bracelet with ID '%s' not found in inventory.", itemId);
178        }
179
180        if (dbManager.deleteBracelet(itemId)) { // Delete from database
181            return String.format("Successfully removed bracelet with ID: %s", itemId);
182        } else {
183            return String.format("Error: Failed to remove bracelet with ID: %s from database.", itemId);
184        }
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Updates a specific field of an existing bracelet in the database.
189     * @param itemId The ID of the bracelet to update.
190     * @param fieldToUpdate The name of the field to update ("quantity", "price", or "status").
191     * @param newValue The new value for the specified field.
192     * @return A string message indicating the outcome (success or error).
193     */
194    public String updateBracelet(String itemId, String fieldToUpdate, String newValue) {
195        if (!validateId(itemId)) {
196            return "Error: Bracelet ID cannot be empty.";
197        }
198
199        Bracelet braceletToUpdate = dbManager.selectBraceletById(itemId); // Get from database
200        if (braceletToUpdate == null) {
201            return String.format("Error: Bracelet with ID '%s' not found in inventory.", itemId);
202        }
203
204        String message = "";
205        boolean changed = false; // Flag to track if any value actually changed
206
207        switch (fieldToUpdate.toLowerCase()) {
208            case "quantity":
209                int newQuantity = validateQuantity(newValue);
210                if (newQuantity != -1) {
211                    if (braceletToUpdate.getQuantity() != newQuantity) { // Only update if value changed
212                        braceletToUpdate.setQuantity(newQuantity);
213                        // Auto-update status based on new quantity
214                        if (newQuantity == 0 && !braceletToUpdate.getStatus().equalsIgnoreCase("Out of Stock")) {
215                            braceletToUpdate.setStatus("Out of Stock");
216                            // FIX: Ensure message matches test expectation exactly
217                            message = "Quantity updated.\nStatus automatically updated to 'Out of Stock'";
218                        } else if (newQuantity > 0 && braceletToUpdate.getStatus().equalsIgnoreCase("Out of Stock")) {
219                            braceletToUpdate.setStatus("In Stock");
220                            // FIX: Ensure message matches test expectation exactly
221                            message = "Quantity updated.\nStatus automatically updated to 'In Stock'";
222                        } else {
223                            message = "Quantity updated.";
224                        }
225                        changed = true;
226                    } else {
227                        return "No change: Quantity is already " + newQuantity + ".";
228                    }
229                } else {
230                    return "Error: New quantity must be a valid non-negative integer.";
231                }
232                break;
233            case "price":
234                double newPrice = validatePrice(newValue);
235                if (newPrice != -1.0) {
236                    if (braceletToUpdate.getPrice() != newPrice) { // Only update if value changed
237                        braceletToUpdate.setPrice(newPrice);
238                        message = "Price updated.";
239                        changed = true;
240                    } else {
241                        return "No change: Price is already " + newPrice + ".";
242                    }
243                } else {
244                    return "Error: New price must be a valid non-negative number.";
245                }
246                break;
247            case "status":
248                if (validateStatus(newValue)) {
249                    if (!braceletToUpdate.getStatus().equalsIgnoreCase(newValue)) { // Only update if value changed
250                        braceletToUpdate.setStatus(newValue);
251                        message = "Status updated.";
252                        changed = true;
253                    } else {
254                        return "No change: Status is already '" + newValue + "'.";
255                    }
256                } else {
257                    return "Error: New status must be 'In Stock' or 'Out of Stock'.";
258                }
259                break;
260            default:
261                return "Error: Invalid field to update. Choose 'quantity', 'price', or 'status'.";
262        }
263
264        if (changed) {
265            if (dbManager.updateBracelet(braceletToUpdate)) { // Update in database
266                return String.format("%s Updated bracelet: %s", message, braceletToUpdate);
267            } else {
268                return String.format("Error: Failed to update bracelet %s in database.", itemId);
269            }
270        } else {
271            return message; // Return "No change" message if no update occurred
272        }
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * Generates a report listing all bracelets whose quantity falls below
277     * a user-specified threshold, fetching data from the database.
278     * @param thresholdStr The string representation of the threshold quantity.
279     * @return A list of Bracelet objects that are below the threshold, or an empty list if none.
280     * If the threshold input is invalid, returns null.
281     */
282    public List<Bracelet> generateLowStockReport(String thresholdStr) {
283        int threshold = validateQuantity(thresholdStr);
284        if (threshold == -1) {
285            return null; // Indicate invalid threshold
286        }
287
288        List<Bracelet> allBracelets = dbManager.selectAllBracelets(); // Get all from database
289        List<Bracelet> lowStockItems = new ArrayList<>();
290        for (Bracelet bracelet : allBracelets) {
291            if (bracelet.getQuantity() < threshold) {
292                lowStockItems.add(bracelet);
293            }
294        }
295        // Sort low stock items by quantity for better readability
296        Collections.sort(lowStockItems, (b1, b2) -> Integer.compare(b1.getQuantity(), b2.getQuantity()));
297        return lowStockItems;
298    }
299}
